DataElement.preferredName: Patient Pain Assessment McGill Questionnaire Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent a patient/person's self assessment of pain at one point in time using the McGill Pain Questionnaire

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's pain assessment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text terms to capture a patient/person self assessment of pain using the McGill Pain Questionnaire._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire incorporating a series of adjectives to describe the characteristics and intensity of pain. The longer version of this instrument was used by Kane and colleagues to evaluate a clinical trial of hospice care. (Wales 1983):Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire incorporating a series of adjectives to describe the characteristics and intensity of pain. The longer version of this instrument was used by Kane and colleagues to evaluate a clinical trial of hospice care. (Wales 1983)
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.origin: MPQ:McGill Pain Questionnaire Short Form, Melzack R, 1987.

DataElement.origin: MPQ:McGill Pain Questionnaire Short Form, Melzack R, 1987.
DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University adoption of C3D for ThermoDox trial.
